instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> distorted image
threads.message:
Board got liquid damage on <CHIP>U7220</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R8400</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U8210</CHIP>, <CHIP>U8400</CHIP>.

It turns on but image is distorted - I can see log in screen.
<RESISTOR>R7226</RESISTOR> and C10CA was not looking great. So replace that with <CHIP>U7220</CHIP> just in case.

Issue is still the same.

Changed LVDS and tested with known good display and same issue.
Tested J8500 with EDP Meter and all readings are correct.

Any idea where to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> distorted image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> distorted image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> distorted image
threads.message:
Then you have problems with CPU (iGPU), or RAM.
Distorted image even on boot menu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> distorted image
threads.message:
Yes, on boot menu as well.
Thanks anyway
